meanings.definition: The set of Jewish dietary laws
meanings.sent1: Following kashruth is important in Jewish tradition.
meanings.sent2: The family observed kashruth by only eating kosher food.
meanings.sent3: The chef mistakenly ignored kashruth and used non-kosher ingredients in the dish.
meanings.sent4: To him, kashruth was like a sacred code guiding his food choices.
meanings.sent5: Learning about kashruth helped her understand the dietary restrictions.

meanings.sent1: The restaurant proudly displayed its kashruth certification.
meanings.sent2: She ensured the kashruth of the meal by checking the labels.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up in the kitchen led to doubts about the kashruth of the entire meal.
meanings.sent4: His commitment to kashruth was unwavering, even in challenging situations.
meanings.sent5: The kashruth of the food was evident in its preparation and ingredients.
